column5: Teamed up with 24/7 and hit that little Gem Lake of his...  And it didn't take long for this Sow hit 24/7's  Williams Wobbler              While 24/7 releases the Beast     I throw down the underwater camera and witness The Northern giving birth to a Healthy 3lb baby boy that quickly fell for a jigging spoon        On the way back home I was lucky enough to snap a pic of this Snowy Owl ..taking a rest from the journey back to the Artic..       If anyone else ever gets the chance to fish with 24/7 ........don't pass it up...
Ahaha, nice nice. Amazing the things you see eh!  Nice little report and big fish for 24/7 and yourself  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
Thats one gorgeous pike you got there...you sure the pike "gave birth"? I thought pike were egg layers as opposed to live bearers...  Good fish though.  Tight Lines, Fishingitis
Now that's funny...  Stun beau brohhhet grand!!
Some beauties there. Love the owl pic.
nice pike i think it has a 4 pound walleye in her

yeah twas an awesome day to be out!  my face is burnt to a crisp tho!  just one thought about the pictures tho whitespinnerbait.  do you do it on purpose.... i mean cutting the tail of the fish in every single picture you take?!??!  arent you supposed to be  grand photographer.  you seriously need practice.  ask cathy how to take a picutre.  i bet you 1000$ she wouldnt cut the pikes head, take half of the sky, or cut the pikes tail.  i just put in a order for you.  photography for dummies 101!
no walleyes in that lake.  maybe a huge rock bass tho!

Is this the same Smallie lake from the summer?  Man I'd kill to get on there and lite'm up!  Kinda bored of Simcoe and Erie(not really, but a chance for fish #'s and size like in previous posts and on a smaller lake, awesome)
Dude...  No need to kill ...just drive down here and we're good to go..
agreed ! I think once im done this school thing im movin out there
Careful!   ...  I am heading that way a couple times this year, St francis area too...  Can you get a bass boat in there?
a simple PM might get you into some 4-5 lbs smallies and largies!

A very nice fat pike definitely well fed and likely full of eggs. did she drop any eggs on the ice?  A few years ago I caught a 48 incher a few weeks before ice out. She was staging on a large flat waiting for conditions to spawn.  this fish was so thick and heavy you wouldn't believe it. she actually had a jelly like substance oozing out between her scales. I have no doubt she weighed over 45 lbs. probably over 50. They do get very very heavy before spawning.

WOW verry interesting man!  no eggs comming out.... but if i recall yes maybe some GEW OOZING out .  yes they are full of eggs wich makes them HEAVY and they are FAT!  kept a smaller one a 3-4 lbs pike and it was full of eggs also!    40 - 50 lbs!  im seriously jelouse of that one!  congrats.   note: that pike would be on my wall.
